FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary

Facility:  Colby Fertilizer, Inc.
Contact:  K.G. Kersenbrock, Manager
Phone:  (785) 462-6440

The owner's, management, and employees of Colby Fertilizer, Inc. are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local sheriffs department, or other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

The primary acitivity at the facility is the storage of anhydrous ammonia to sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  The maximum quantity stored would be 370,000 in storage tanks and nurse tanks.

The facility is in compliance with the provisions of standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of anhydrous ammonia".  The OSHA standard is referenced in the RMP Regristraion Form; see Section 8.3(b).

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia if the past five years theat have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility.

The facility has:
A. A written action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38.
B. Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title (EPCRA):
C. If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, the required response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and call 911 and all applicabe emergency response numbers.
     1. With-in 15 minutes of determining the amount of the release would be over 100 pounds, the emergency coordinator will notify: The National Emergency Response Center @800/424-8802.
     2. With-in 24 hours of determining the amount of release would effect athe environment, the emergency coordinator will notify; Kan

sas Bureau of Environment Remediation @785/296-1679 or after normal business hours @785/296-0614 and The Dansas Department of Emergency Management @785/296-3176.

Safety improvements are an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions of the facility.  There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implimentation at this time.
